### Welcome to the RAML API portal for the <a href="https://stackexchange.com" target="_blank"><img src="data:image/png;base64," width="24px"> StackExchange API</a>! 

This portal provides 
- a [RAML spec]( /apiplatform/repository/public/organizations/30/apis/7956/versions/8119/files/root) describing the StackExchange API in a clear, human- and machine-readable format
- [documentation](/apiplatform/popular/#/portals/apis/7956/versions/8119/pages/6741) of the StackExchange API auto-generated from the RAML spec
- the [documentation](/apiplatform/popular/#/portals/apis/7956/versions/8119/pages/6741) is live: you can make calls to the StackExchange API from the documentation
- live, documented usecases for the StackExchange API, provided as API notebooks, and exercising much of the StackExchange API

_This portal is built on the Anypoint Platform for APIs, using RAML version 0.8._

_For more information about RAML, see [http://raml.org](http://raml.org)._

_The API notebooks are all executable! Hit "enter" in any code cell to execute it (and all cells before it that have not executed yet), or scroll to the bottom of the notebook and click "Play notebook". For more information, see [http://apinotebook.com](http://apinotebook.com)._

---
### Please note:

This portal and its contents are not affiliated with StackExchange. They are, however, useful for working with, and learning about, the StackExchange API.

The official developer API portal for StackExchange is at <a href="https://api.stackexchange.com/docs​" target="_blank">https://api.stackexchange.com/docs​</a>
